description: The cumulative total of confirmed Covid-19 cases. Confirmed cases include presumptive positive cases and probable cases, in accordance with CDC guidelines as of April 14.
reference: Dong, E., Du, H., & Gardner, L. (2020). An interactive web-based dashboard to track COVID-19 in real time. The Lancet, 20(5), 533–534. https://doi.org/10.1016/S1473-3099(20)30120-1
notes: China includes Hong Kong; Denmark includes Greenland; France includes overseas territories; Netherlands includes overseas territories; United Kingdom includes overseas territories

description: The cumulative total of deaths from Covid-19. Death totals in the US include confirmed and probable, in accordance with CDC guidelines as of April 14.
reference: Dong, E., Du, H., & Gardner, L. (2020). An interactive web-based dashboard to track COVID-19 in real time. The Lancet, 20(5), 533–534. https://doi.org/10.1016/S1473-3099(20)30120-1
notes: China includes Hong Kong; Denmark includes Greenland; France includes overseas territories; Netherlands includes overseas territories; United Kingdom includes overseas territories

description: The cumulative total of recoveries from Covid-19. Recovered cases outside China are estimates based on local media reports, and state and local reporting when available, and therefore may be substantially lower than the true number.
reference: Dong, E., Du, H., & Gardner, L. (2020). An interactive web-based dashboard to track COVID-19 in real time. The Lancet, 20(5), 533–534. https://doi.org/10.1016/S1473-3099(20)30120-1
notes: China includes Hong Kong; Denmark includes Greenland; France includes overseas territories; Netherlands includes overseas territories; United Kingdom includes overseas territories

reference: Roser, M., Ritchie, H., Ortiz-Ospina, E., & Hasell, J. (2020). Coronavirus Pandemic (COVID-19). Our World in Data. https://ourworldindata.org/coronavirus
notes: Data from European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control

description: New tests for COVID-19 (7-day smoothed). For countries that don't report testing data on a daily basis, we assume that testing changed equally on a daily basis over any periods in which no data was reported. This produces a complete series of daily figures, which is then averaged over a rolling 7-day window
reference: Roser, M., Ritchie, H., Ortiz-Ospina, E., & Hasell, J. (2020). Coronavirus Pandemic (COVID-19). Our World in Data. https://ourworldindata.org/coronavirus
notes: Units across countries are not consistent (tests performed vs people tested vs samples tested). Data from national government reports.

description: Government Response Stringency Index: composite measure based on 9 response indicators including school closures, workplace closures, and travel bans, rescaled to a value from 0 to 100 (100 = strictest response)
reference: Roser, M., Ritchie, H., Ortiz-Ospina, E., & Hasell, J. (2020). Coronavirus Pandemic (COVID-19). Our World in Data. https://ourworldindata.org/coronavirus
notes: Data from Oxford COVID-19 Government Response Tracker, Blavatnik School of Government
